intro: Erysimum candicum subsp. candicum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, basal leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is part of the Brassicaceae family. The subspecies candicum is distinguished by its specific floral and leaf morphology compared to other Erysimum species.
